title.narrative: 1.2: DISAGGREGATED DATA AND ANALYSIS ONCHILDREN

description.narrative: Output 2: Increased availability of quality disaggregated data and analysis on children, for more inclusive and equitable decision- making., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Social inclusion and dataBy 2022, poor and vulnerable children are better identified and increasingly benefit from child- sensitive and integrated social protection systems and child-responsive national policies and public spending.

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
PF4C: Budget transparency, accountability and participation
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2: Increased availability of quality disaggregated data and analysis on children, for more inclusive and equitable decision- making.

description.narrative: Evidence on situation of children in Egypt was made available through successful and long-standing partnerships with government counterparts, academic institutions and research agencies to inform policy dialogue and promote evidence-based policy formulation through updated databases, primary collection of quantitative and qualitative data and their analyses, analytical papers using in-depth secondary data analysis, user-friendly data driven platforms, effective advocacy on issues that affect child well-being using channels of seminars and conferences. Knowledge and participation of Egyptian population on national budgets and resource allocation increased by enhancing transparency and citizen engagement through the Citizen Budget Initiative to increase realization of child rights. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/12/2019

title.narrative: Ind. 1.2.3:Number of products related to public finance for children (e.g. budget analysis, online videos, infographics, etc.) implemented and/or developed, with support from UNICEF
Ind. 1.2.1: Number of HH surveys (including other primary data collection) and databases supported to provide disaggregated data on most excluded children with focus on the SDGs

Ind. 1.2.2:Number of knowledge and advocacy products (analytical papers - based on studies, policy briefs, statistical briefs, snapshots, panel discussion briefs, dashboards, apps) on the situation of children, including on climate change and urbanization (excluding Social protection related products-to be accounted in 1.1), developed and disseminated
3.2 Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children
1.3 Advocacy is shaped by child poverty analysis (media and social media campaigns
National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures

actual.value: 2019:Discussions ongoing with partners to produce an MPI for Egypt
